block.p: Susan Elizabeth Jackson and Eric David Pomerance were married yesterday by the Rev. James Speer at the First Presbyterian Church in New York. Rabbi Burt Aaron Siegel took part in the ceremony.

The bride, 36, is the classical music and opera editor at Time Out New York, a weekly magazine devoted to music and other events in New York City. She graduated cum laude from Princeton University and received a master's degree in education from Stanford. From 1993 to 1995, she was a reporter in Chile for Business Week. Ms. Jackson, who will keep her name, is a daughter of Mary and William Jackson of Allentown, Pa., where her father is a retired management consultant.

The bridegroom, 38, is a screenwriter in New York. His most recent screenplay, which has the working title ''I'm With Katie,'' is being produced by Gaumont Pictures, a Paris movie studio. The film, a romantic comedy, is scheduled for filming in autumn. Mr. Pomerance is a former writer for several television shows, including ''Dear John'' and ''Out All Night,'' both on NBC. He graduated from Williams College. He is the son of Samantha and Laurence Pomerance of Manhattan. His mother, who is retired, was a secretary with Bessemer Trust, a bank in New York. His father is a stockbroker at Fahnestock & Company in New York.
